newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croat Zagrebacka Bank shares in demand.
newsitem.headline: Croat Zagrebacka Bank shares in demand.

text.p: Shares in Croatian Zagrebacka Banka were in the spotlight on the Zagreb Stock Exchange on Wednesday, with some 6,000 sold and the price rising steadily, traders said.

"The volume of Zagrebacka Banka shares sold by 1000 GMT was an outstanding 6,000. Its price has risen by 200 kuna over the past week and is now hovering around 2,100 kuna per share," one trader told Reuters.
On Wednesday, Zagrebacka Banka closed at 2,000 kuna, up 29.9 or 1.5 percent up from a day earlier and selling 2,768 shares.

The trader added that the reason for Zagrebacka Banka share prices enjoying an upward trend was the rise of its Global Depositary Receipts on the London Stock Exchange, but could not explain why the prices had been pushed up there.
At 1030 GMT Zagrebacka was quoted at $33.45 in London, compared to last night's close $32.88.
